name: Witch Bones
description: These are the remains of Mary Bateman, aka “The Yorkshire Witch”. In the early 19th century, she was tried and executed for witchcraft and the murder of Rebecca Perigo. In a gruesome finale after her death, her body was put on public display where strips of skin were sold off as evil warding magic charms. What was left of her is now on display at Thackray Museum in Leeds… This screen print from Babycrow features a slightly metallic gun metal black that catches the light with a subtle sheen and is printed on 600gsm handmade cotton paper. Hand Pulled Screen Print Edition of 15 560 × 760mm
